Most patient develop AF architectural anisotropic micro change atrial myocardium . These cause heterogeneous discontinuous change pattern impulse propagation , heterogeneous atrial activation shorten atrial refractory period [ 2 , 3 ] . Since 1911 standard EKG [ 4 ] ( approximately 15 second record bandwidth 0.05 150 Hz ) use tool evaluation patient arrhythmias , due low cost high availability . Various electrocardiographic pattern know predictor AF evidence direct visual inspection . For example , prolongation P wave duration sinus rhythm would correlate structural change increase size leave atrium ( increase leave atrial pressure ) decrease drive time [ 5 ] . These change favor development reentry circuit responsible development maintenance AF . The registration electrocardiographic activity provide much information evidence direct visual inspection . Biosignal processing specific technique detect potential delay cause abnormal conduction myocardium favor re-entry mechanism [ 6-10 ] . For purpose prolong ECG 1000 Hz sample frequency . Knowledge prediction development AF standard ECG obvious visual inspection limit . Many structural change anisotropic , occur slowly time may evidence direct variation 2 ECG individual [ 11 ] . Little known whether difference morphology , axis , scope duration P wave relate structural change may predict development AF . Our main purpose evaluate prognostic performance set parameter evidence direct inspection ECG , ECG change 2 predict FA development . The design tool could allow future generation software capable identify reporting variation , useful prognostic risk patient AF .

DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients 18 year Health Plan member Italian Hospital Buenos Aires least 2 ECG separate . 1 . Patients sinus rhythm different . 2 . Patients history congenital heart disease ( tetralogy fallot , CIA ) 3 . Patients implanted defibrillator pacemaker . 4 . Patients history cardiac surgery perform heart surgery last ECG development AF . 5 . Patients history radiofrequency ablation treatment arrhythmia .
